author: Staff Reporter
text:
Policemen pacifying protesters after an accident that occurred between Tindivanam and Puducherry near Thailapuram on Wednesday. -Photo: S.S. Kumar

Six persons were injured after the personal escort vehicle of PMK founder S. Ramadoss ploughed into a waiting crowd at a bus stop at Katrampakkam near Kiliyanur on Wednesday evening.

Police sources said the car bound to Thailapuram from Tindivanam swerved to avoid hitting a pedestrian crossing the four-lane highway at Katrampakkam. The driver of the car lost control and hit two motorists and ploughed the vehicle into a group of people headed towards Puducherry who were waiting at a bus stop.

Tension mounted after locals resorted to a road blockade at Katrampakkam demanding the arrest of the car driver. Protesters were chased away by police to avert a traffic bottleneck.

The injured have been admitted to Jawaharlal Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education and Research.

Doctors said the patients were treated for minor injuries with TT injections and painkillers.

Further investigations are on, police said.
title: 6 injured as Ramadoss’ escort vehicle ploughs into crowd
